document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the freshwater crabs of Costa Rica, with a revision of the genus Ptychophallus Smalley, 1964 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Pseudothelphusidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 71–76 .
Potamocarcinus magnus (Rathbun, 1896)
: 71, left first gonopod, holotype, USNM 19049, caudal-mesial view; 72, same data, latero-cephalic view of distal part.
Potamocarcinus nicaraguensis Rathbun, 1893: 73
, left first gonopod, INPA 1869, caudal-mesial view; 74, same data, lateral view of distal part.
Potamocarcinus richmondi (Rathbun, 1893)
: 75, left first gonopod, TMNH Acc. Nr. 94-100, caudal-mesial view; 76, same data, lateral view of distal part (ce, cephalic process; cp, caudal process; cst, caudal setae; fas, field of apical spines; ls, lateral suture; me, mesial process; mp, marginal process; ms, marginal suture). Scale bars: 71, 75 = 1 mm; 72–74, 76 = 2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntypes and type locality
. Two males, USNM 19048 and 19049 . Costa Rica , Pozo Azul.
Rathbun ( 1896 )
offered no further information about this locality.

Distribution . Western and central Costa Rica , in both Atlantic and Pacific drainages (
Fig. 86
). The species also occurs in Mexico , Guatemala , El Salvador (
Rodriguez 1982
), Honduras (
Pretzmann 1980 , as
Potamocarcinus ( Megathelphusa )
magnus hondurensis ), and Nicaragua (C. Magalhães, unpublished).
